Description: Page from photograph album containing views of Egypt and the Middle East: One mounted photograph on page and two loose photographs. The mounted photograph depicts four figures, one in military uniform. The two unmounted photographs are annotated on the reverse and depict a Yazidi man in front of the shrine of Shaikh Adi which Rev. Hughes describes as the 'Temple of Devil Worshippers'. The second loose photograph shows three figures, named in the annotation as Flight Officer Hodders, Nibs and Perry Keene in front of a collection of weapons.
Producer name: Photographed by: Rev William Percy Hughes
Curator's comments: The photograph captioned as "" was taken at the entreance to the famous Yezidi shrine of Shaikh Adi, in Jebel Sinjar in northern Iraq. The blackened carving of a snake is partly visible behind the individual in the photograph.
Associated names: Representation of: Rev William Percy Hughes
